title: Contemporary Art and Artists Part 2 - Multiple Choice Questions
subtitle: NIOS Class 12 Painting - Module 2: Amrita Shergil, M.F. Hussain, K.K. Hebbar

questions.question: What are the unique features of Jamini Roy's paintings?
options: Dark contour lines, big fish-like eyes and small nose and mouth
questions.explanation: The unique features of his painting are the dark contour lines, big fish-like eyes and small nose and mouth.

questions.question: What award did Jamini Roy receive in 1934?
questions.explanation: In 1934, he received the Viceroy's gold medal in an all-India exhibition.

questions.question: When was Jamini Roy awarded the Padma Bhushan?
questions.explanation: In 1954 he was awarded the Padma Bhushan by the Government of India.

questions.question: At what age did Jamini Roy die?
questions.explanation: Jamini Roy died at the age of 85 in Kolkata in 1972.

questions.question: What is the medium of Jamini Roy's 'Mother and Child' painting?
questions.explanation: The medium of 'Mother and Child' is Tempera on canvas.

questions.question: In which arm is the mother holding the child in 'Mother and Child'?
questions.explanation: This painting shows the mother's curvy figure in the centre of the painting, holding the child in her left arm.

questions.question: What color is the mother's right arm decorated with in 'Mother and Child'?
questions.explanation: Perfectly balanced with the right arm's Aalta (red) colour and one foot at the bottom.

questions.question: What color strip marks decorate the child in 'Mother and Child'?
questions.explanation: The child's arm, leg and forehead have been decorated with white strip marks.

questions.question: When was Amrita Shergil born?
questions.explanation: Amrita Shergil, one of the most famous painters of India, was born on 30th January 1913 in Budapest, Hungary.

questions.question: Where was Amrita Shergil born?
questions.explanation: Amrita Shergil was born on 30th January 1913 in Budapest, Hungary.

questions.question: What was Amrita Shergil's mother's profession?
questions.explanation: Her mother was a Hungarian singer.

questions.question: When did Amrita Shergil's family shift to Shimla?
questions.explanation: In 1921, her family shifted from Hungary to the beautiful hill station of Shimla.

questions.question: From whom did Amrita Shergil take tuition in Shimla?
questions.explanation: During her stay in Shimla, Amrita became interested in painting and started taking tuition from an Italian sculptor living there.

questions.question: Under whom did Amrita Shergil receive formal training in Paris?
questions.explanation: She received formal training in painting in Paris under Lucien Simon.

questions.question: Which European painters greatly influenced Amrita Shergil?
options: Vincent van Gogh and Claude Monet
questions.explanation: During that time, she was greatly influenced by European painters like Paul Cezanne and Paul Gauguin.

questions.question: When did Amrita Shergil return to India?
questions.explanation: Amrita Shergil returned to India in the year 1934 and, from then onwards, began her never-ending journey in the field of the traditions of Indian art.

questions.question: Which Indian painting styles influenced Amrita Shergil after returning to India?
questions.explanation: In the country, she was influenced by the Mughal miniatures schools as well as the Ajanta paintings.

questions.question: What status have Amrita Shergil's works been given by the Government of India?
questions.explanation: The works of Amrita Shergil have been declared National Art Treasures by the Government of India.

questions.question: Who did Amrita Shergil marry?
options: Her Hungarian first cousin, Dr Victor Egan
questions.explanation: Amrita married her Hungarian first cousin, Dr Victor Egan, in 1938.

questions.question: At what age did Amrita Shergil die?
questions.explanation: In 1941, at the age of 28, Amrita Shergil departed this world.

questions.question: What is the title of one of Amrita Shergil's most famous paintings?
questions.explanation: One of her famous paintings is 'Bride's Toilet' created in 1937 C.E.

questions.question: What medium did Amrita Shergil use for 'Bride's Toilet'?
questions.explanation: The medium of 'Bride's Toilet' is Oil on canvas.

questions.question: How many figures are in the composition 'Bride's Toilet'?
questions.explanation: Bride's Toilet is a composition with five figures and two earthen pots.

questions.question: What color are the bride's hands painted with in 'Bride's Toilet'?
questions.explanation: The bride's hands are painted with red colour (Alta).

questions.question: What is unique about one maid's blouse in 'Bride's Toilet'?
questions.explanation: The polka dot pattern blouse of one maid is a unique feature in this painting.

questions.question: Which painting styles influenced 'Bride's Toilet'?
questions.explanation: This painting is influenced by the Ajanta murals and Rajput paintings. Here she has combined her European technique with the Ajanta style.

questions.question: Whose work influenced the faces in 'Bride's Toilet'?
questions.explanation: The influence of Paul Gauguin in this painting can be clearly seen by matching the face of the central maid and the painting of 'Tahitian women' of Paul Gauguin.

questions.question: When was M.F. Hussain born?
questions.explanation: M.F. Hussain, or Maqbool Fida Hussain, was born on 17th September 1915 in the Pandharpur town of Maharashtra.

questions.question: Where was M.F. Hussain born?
questions.explanation: M.F. Hussain was born in the Pandharpur town of Maharashtra.

questions.question: When did M.F. Hussain move to Bombay (Mumbai)?
questions.explanation: He moved to Bombay (Now Mumbai) in 1935.

questions.question: How did M.F. Hussain start his painting career?
options: As a painter of cinema hoardings
questions.explanation: MF Hussain started his painting career as a painter of cinema hoardings.

questions.question: When did M.F. Hussain join the Progressive Artist's Group?
questions.explanation: In the year 1947, he joined the Progressive Artist's Group.

questions.question: What award was M.F. Hussain given by the Government of India?
questions.explanation: He has been awarded the Padma Bhushan.

questions.question: Which film by M.F. Hussain won a 'Golden Bear' at the Berlin Film Festival?
options: Meenakshi: A Tale of three cities
Through the Eyes of a Painter

questions.question: When did M.F. Hussain pass away?
questions.explanation: M.F. Hussain passed away in London on 9th June 2011 after a silent heart attack.

questions.question: Where did M.F. Hussain pass away?
questions.explanation: M.F. Hussain passed away in London on 9th June 2011.

questions.question: What is the title of M.F. Hussain's famous Ganesha painting?
questions.explanation: The painting is titled 'Naad Swaram Ganeshayem' created in 2004 C.E.

questions.question: What medium did M.F. Hussain use for 'Naad Swaram Ganeshayem'?
questions.explanation: The medium of 'Naad Swaram Ganeshayem' is Acrylic on canvas.

questions.question: How many heads does Ganesha have in Hussain's 'Naad Swaram Ganeshayem'?
questions.explanation: Here Ganesha has two heads in different colours; the heads have one tooth each.

questions.question: What is Ganesha playing in 'Naad Swaram Ganeshayem'?
questions.explanation: Playing Naad with one hand, from another hand he is bouncing a pale modak or may be a moon.

questions.question: What colors are Ganesha's arms in Hussain's painting?
questions.explanation: Again one arm is yellow in colour and the other is red.

questions.question: What color is Ganesha's dhoti in the painting?
questions.explanation: To create maximum contrast, the white dhoti in Indian style is depicted.

questions.question: Whose work does the treatment of 'Naad Swaram Ganeshayem' remind us of?
questions.explanation: The treatment of background and foreground reminds us of Paul Cezanne's work.

questions.question: What are Hussain's paintings a combination of?
questions.explanation: His paintings are a combination of mythology and modern life.

questions.question: When was K.K. Hebbar born?
questions.explanation: Kattingeri Krishna Hebbar was born in 1911 at Kattingeri in the Udupi district of Karnataka.

questions.question: Where was K.K. Hebbar born?
questions.explanation: Kattingeri Krishna Hebbar was born in 1911 at Kattingeri in the Udupi district of Karnataka.

questions.question: Which artists influenced K.K. Hebbar during his Kerala Period?
options: Raja Ravi Varma and Abanindranath Tagore
Paul Gauguin and Amrita Sher Gil
questions.explanation: During his early years, known as his Kerala Period, Hebbar was highly influenced by Paul Gauguin and Amrita Sher Gil.

questions.question: What was Hebbar's style a unique combination of?
questions.explanation: Hebbar's style was a unique combination of impressionistic and expressionistic techniques.

questions.question: What classical Indian dance form influenced Hebbar's work?
questions.explanation: His drawings and paintings capture the grace of dance performances, influenced by his study of the classical Indian dance form, Kathak.

questions.question: Where did K.K. Hebbar study art in Europe?
questions.explanation: He then went to Europe to study art at the Academy of Julian in Paris.
